item.title: 3x3 Mbps Ethernet Doubles Your Bandwidth
item.description:
In today’s world, who couldn’t benefit from additional internet speed? Websites, software, and files continue to grow larger, but unfortunately, technology budgets haven’t kept pace. Imagine doubling your internet speed without increasing your current expenses â€“ an appealing proposition, wouldn’t you agree? It might sound illogical to suggest that doubling your internet speed wouldn’t cost more, especially since internet providers aren’t known for giving things away for free. The secret lies in adopting newer, more cost-effective technology instead of simply replacing your existing service with an identical one from another provider...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/3x3-mbps-ethernet-doubles-your-bandwidth/

item.title: Ethernet In The First Mile Advantages
item.description:
Metropolitan and Wide Area Networks can send your data anywhere you want. To access these networks, you need a connection known as “first mile” or “last mile” connectivity. Ethernet offers advantages for this first mile link. Several technologies, such as T1 lines, DSL, SONET fiber optic services, and even microwave or 3G/4G wireless, work well for first mile connections. These options connect your building to your service provider or a gateway to their network...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ethernet-in-the-first-mile-advantages/

item.title: Fixed Wireless Broadband Includes Canada & Puerto Rico
item.description:
People often associate broadband with wired connections, like T1 lines commonly used by small to medium businesses, or the increasingly popular Ethernet option known for its speed and affordability. While satellite is vital for many chain stores, there’s another reliable broadband solution that avoids construction costs and high monthly fees: fixed wireless broadband, now available across the US, Canada, and Puerto Rico. Accel Networks, a leading provider of fixed wireless broadband, leverages existing 2...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/fixed-wireless-broadband-includes-canada-puerto-rico/

item.title: MegaPath Pushes EoC to 400 Mbps
item.description:
Ethernet over Copper (EoC) services are constantly achieving higher bandwidth capacities, making businesses reconsider the need for fiber optic installations. MegaPath, for example, now offers EoC speeds up to 400 Mbps. Many companies use EoC as a cost-effective alternative to T1 lines, obtaining double the bandwidth at the same price. Options like 2x2 Mbps and 3x3 Mbps are particularly favored. Others transition to mid-band Ethernet, offering 10 to 20 Mbps, which exceeds bonded T1 capabilities and suits mid-sized businesses...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/megapath-pushes-eoc-to-400-mbps/
